author: Cameron Mcwhirter
title: States Push to Raise Gasoline Taxes - WSJ
text:
States Push to Raise Gasoline Taxes Tennessee and Alaska are among the states looking to tax motorists more after decades with no increase By Google+ Feb. 21, 2017 5:30 a.m. ET 
Tennessee Gov. Bill Haslam is putting his fellow Republican lawmakers to the test, with a plan to raise the state’s gas taxes for the first time in nearly three decades. 
He joins a string of governors who have pushed through similar increases. “We need to do something,” Mr. Haslam said in a recent interview, asserting that a gas tax is the most equitable revenue stream to use to fix roads. He said his plan would raise about $278... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
